plyexperiment 0.0.99.2
  • Reference

Tidy manipulation of SummarizedExperiment objects by column.

tidy_col.Rd

Tidy manipulation of SummarizedExperiment objects by column.

mutate_col(object, ...)

rename_col(object, ...)

filter_col(object, ...)

arrange_col(object, ...)

select_col(object, ...)

Arguments

object

a SummarizedExperiment object.
...

Additional arguments to be passed to the relevant dplyr functions.

Value

A modified SingleCellExperiment object.

Details

The mutate_col function calls mutate to add new column variables to colData(object).

The rename_col function calls rename to rename column variables to colData(object).

The filter_col function calls filter to subset object by column, based on the matching elements in rows of colData(object).

The arrange_col function calls arrange to order columns by the corresponding variable in colData(object).

Examples

y <- matrix(rnorm(2000), ncol=20)
se <- SummarizedExperiment(list(counts=y))
se$whee <- sample(LETTERS, ncol(y), replace=TRUE)

(se2 <- mutate_col(se, yay = runif(ncol(y))))
#> class: SummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 100 20 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames: NULL
#> colData names(2): whee yay

(se3 <- rename_col(se, blah = whee))
#> class: SummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 100 20 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames: NULL
#> colData names(1): blah

(se4 <- filter_col(se, whee == "A"))
#> class: SummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 100 2 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames: NULL
#> colData names(1): whee

(se5 <- arrange_col(se, whee))
#> class: SummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 100 20 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames: NULL
#> rowData names(0):
#> colnames: NULL
#> colData names(1): whee
